metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2268 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the MathML implementation in WebKit in Google Chrome before 25.0.1364.97 on Windows and Linux, and before 25.0.1364.99 on Mac OS X, has unknown impact and remote attack vectors, related to a "high severity security issue."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2268` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 25.0.1364.160-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 25.0.1364.160-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 25.0.1364.160-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 25.0.1364.160-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 25.0.1364.160-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '25.0.1364.160-0ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
